about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

about.name: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way:

hasPart.assesses: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: | Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

comment.text: Only at controlled intersections.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.

comment.text: Only when a crosswalk is painted on the street.

suggestedAnswer.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

comment.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

acceptedAnswer.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

comment.text: Whether or not a crosswalk is marked.

answerExplanation.text: Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

comment.text: Pedestrians crossing at corners have the right-of-way: | Respect the right-of-way of pedestrians. Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at a corner or crosswalk, even if the corner is without traffic signal lights. You should stop for pedestrians crossing at any crosswalk, whether or not the crosswalk is marked by painted lines.

hasPart.text: Regulatory signs provide notice to road users of traffic laws that must be obeyed. Where this sign is present, drivers must drive in the direction indicated by the arrow.

comment.text: No right turn.

suggestedAnswer.text: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.

comment.text: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.
Curve ahead.

acceptedAnswer.text: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.

comment.text: Drive only in the direction of the arrow.

hasPart.assesses: When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should: | When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop only if pedestrians are on the sidewalk.

comment.text: Stop only if pedestrians are on the sidewalk.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.

comment.text: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.

suggestedAnswer.text: Expect pedestrians on the sidewalk to yield the right-of-way.

comment.text: Expect pedestrians on the sidewalk to yield the right-of-way.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.

comment.text: Stop before driving onto the sidewalk or sidewalk area.

answerExplanation.text: When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

comment.text: When crossing a sidewalk to enter traffic from an alley or driveway, drivers should: | When leaving an alley, driveway, or parking lot to enter a roadway, you must stop before driving onto a sidewalk or sidewalk area. Pedestrians and existing traffic have the right-of-way.

hasPart.name: If your car begins to skid out of control, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If your car begins to skid out of control, you should: | If your car begins to skid out of control, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, stay off the brakes. Continue to correct your steering until the vehicle is back under your control and moving safely down the road.

comment.text: Pump the brakes.
Apply the brakes lightly.
Stay off the brakes.
Stay off the brakes.

answerExplanation.text: If your vehicle begins to skid, stay off the brakes. Continue to correct your steering until the vehicle is back under your control and moving safely down the road.
